name: Auto-translate Documentation
description: Automatically translates README and docs files to multiple languages when saved
prompt:
The file {{filePath}} has been updated. Translate this file into French (fr), Hebrew (he), Italian (it), Japanese (ja), Portuguese (pt), and Chinese (zh).

**CRITICAL STRUCTURE REQUIREMENTS:**
1. Preserve EXACT markdown structure:
   - Same number of headers (# ## ###)
   - Same header hierarchy and nesting
   - Same number of code blocks with identical content
   - Same number of lists, tables, and sections
   - All emojis in same positions (‚úÖ üë®‚Äçüíª üöÄ etc.)
   - All horizontal rules (---) in same positions
   - All HTML comments and collapsible sections

2. DO NOT translate:
   - Code blocks (bash, yaml, python, etc.) - keep 100% identical
   - Command names: smus-cli, git, pip, etc.
   - File names: manifest.yaml, README.md, etc.
   - URLs and links
   - AWS service names: SageMaker, Glue, Athena, DataZone, S3, etc.
   - Technical terms: CLI, CI/CD, DevOps, workflow, pipeline, bundle, manifest
   - Variable names and parameters

3. TRANSLATE naturally:
   - Descriptive text and explanations
   - Section headings (but keep technical terms in English)
   - User-facing messages
   - Documentation prose

4. Reference style: Check docs/langs/pt/README.md for translation style examples

5. Save to: docs/langs/{language-code}/{{fileName}}
   - Maintain subdirectory structure (e.g., developer/guide.md ‚Üí docs/langs/fr/developer/guide.md)

6. Quality check before saving:
   - Count headers in source vs translation (must match)
   - Count code blocks in source vs translation (must match)
   - Verify all emojis present
   - Verify all links work
